programDescription: Below you'll find a detailed single-page layout for Week 1. It outlines the daily workouts and important notes for form and consistency. You can print this page and reference it at the gym. Enjoy!

1.title: üèÉ‚Äç‚ôÄÔ∏è‚Äç‚û°Ô∏èüèãÔ∏è‚Äç‚ôÄÔ∏è Week 1

main: Start moderate on weights; focus on form
Keep rest around 60-90s on main movements, ~30-45s on smaller movements
Track how you feel and any needed adjustments

exercises.name: Treadmill/Bike + Dynamic Stretches
exercises.notes: Arm circles, hip circles, bodyweight squats

blocks.name: Block 1

exercises.name: Barbell Squats
exercises.notes: Keep chest up, drive through heels

exercises.name: Dumbbell Bent-Over Rows
exercises.notes: Flat back, hinge at hips, row elbows back

blocks.notes: Swap after each set, then rest ~60s

exercises.name: Overhead Press
exercises.notes: Engage core, avoid arching back

exercises.name: Plank
exercises.notes: Keep hips level, core tight

exercises.name: Biceps Curls
exercises.notes: Elbows close to torso, no swinging

exercises.name: Triceps Overhead Extensions
exercises.notes: Elbows point forward, control descent

tuesday.name: Cardio

structure.name: Intervals
structure.notes: Alternate higher effort with low effort

structure.name: Cool-down
structure.notes: Easy pace to gradually lower heart rate

notes: Swap machines halfway if desired

exercises.name: Light Cardio + Upper Body Mobility
exercises.notes: Arm swings, shoulder rolls, scap retractions

exercises.name: Bench Press or Floor Press
exercises.notes: Elbows ~45¬∞ from torso

exercises.name: Bent-Over Row
exercises.notes: Flat back, pull elbows up and back

exercises.name: Shoulder Press
exercises.notes: Seated or standing, core tight

exercises.name: Side Planks
exercises.notes: Or regular plank variation; keep hips high

exercises.name: Biceps Curls
exercises.notes: Controlled tempo

exercises.name: Triceps Extensions
exercises.notes: Elbows in, full range of motion

thursday.name: Cardio
notes: Repeat Tuesday's approach. Adjust intensity or time as needed

exercises.name: 5 min Easy Cardio + Leg/Glute Activation
exercises.notes: Hip openers, leg swings, bodyweight squats

exercises.name: Deadlifts
exercises.notes: Hinge at hips, back flat

exercises.name: Lunges
exercises.notes: Step forward or backward, keep torso upright

exercises.name: Glute Bridges / Hip Thrusts
exercises.notes: Bodyweight or with bar/dumbbell across hips

exercises.name: Calf Raises
exercises.notes: Lift heels, brief pause at top

exercises.name: Plank (~30s) & Bicycle Crunch (10 reps/side)
exercises.notes: Perform simultaneously, then swap or rest briefly before next set

saturday.name: Rest or Active Recovery
notes: Light walk or easy bike (20‚Äì30 min), gentle stretching

sunday.name: Full Rest
notes: No planned exercise

printingNotes: Print this 'Week 1' on a single sheet (front and back if desired)
Bring to your workout area or keep on your phone for reference
Check off sets/reps as you complete them and note any weight changes

2.title: Week 2

main: Assess weight loads: If you can do all sets easily, add a bit more weight next time

monday.name: Full-Body Strength
notes: Add +1 set to either Squats or Overhead Press (4 sets instead of 3).
If you already feel comfortable, also consider adding 1‚Äì2 reps.

exercises.name: Treadmill/Bike + Dynamic Stretches
exercises.notes: Arm circles, hip circles, bodyweight squats

exercises.name: Barbell Squats
exercises.notes: If comfortable, do 4 sets total

exercises.name: Dumbbell Bent-Over Rows
exercises.notes: Flat back, hinge at hips

exercises.name: Overhead Press
exercises.notes: Add +1 set (4 total) if not added on squats

exercises.name: Plank
exercises.notes: Possibly bump to 45s if comfortable

exercises.name: Biceps Curls
exercises.notes: Increase reps if easy

exercises.name: Triceps Overhead Extensions
exercises.notes: Elbows point forward, controlled tempo

tuesday.name: Cardio
notes: Intervals: Extend work intervals to 1:15 or do 12 total intervals if you want more challenge
Steady-State: Increase main work to ~25 min

structure.name: Intervals
structure.notes: Increase intensity or rounds for progression

structure.name: Main Work
structure.notes: Consider slight incline or higher resistance

wednesday.name: Upper-Body Strength
notes: Add +1 set to Bench/Floor Press or Shoulder Press
Increase plank holds from 30s to 45s if comfortable

exercises.name: Light Cardio + Upper Body Mobility
exercises.notes: Arm swings, shoulder rolls, scapular retractions

exercises.name: Bench Press or Floor Press
exercises.notes: Add 4th set if desired

exercises.name: Bent-Over Row
exercises.notes: Flat back, pull elbows up and back

exercises.name: Shoulder Press
exercises.notes: Consider 4th set if not added to Bench

exercises.name: Side Planks (or Plank Variation)
exercises.notes: Try increasing to 45s

exercises.name: Biceps Curls
exercises.notes: Increase weight or reps if easy

exercises.name: Triceps Extensions
exercises.notes: Keep elbows in, full extension

thursday.name: Cardio
notes: Same as Tuesday; increase intensity or time slightly

friday.name: Lower-Body Strength
notes: Add +1 set to Deadlifts or Lunges
If Deadlifts feel easy, add more weight

exercises.name: 5 min Easy Cardio + Leg Swings
exercises.notes: Hip openers, bodyweight squats

exercises.name: Deadlifts
exercises.notes: Add a 4th set if desired

exercises.name: Lunges
exercises.notes: Increase to 4 sets if not added to Deadlifts

exercises.name: Glute Bridges / Hip Thrusts
exercises.notes: Add weight if bodyweight is easy

exercises.name: Calf Raises
exercises.notes: Lift heels, brief pause

exercises.name: Plank (~30-45s) & Bicycle Crunch (10 reps/side)
exercises.notes: Perform simultaneously; rest briefly, then repeat

saturday.name: Rest or Active Recovery
notes: Light walk/bike, gentle stretching

sunday.name: Full Rest
notes: Complete rest day

printingNotes: Print this 'Week 2' on a single sheet (front and back if desired)
Bring to your workout area or keep on your phone for reference
Check off sets/reps as you complete them and note any weight changes

3.title: Week 3

main: If form is solid, increase weight on main lifts
Consider lengthening intervals or reducing rest times

monday.name: Full-Body Strength
notes: Increase weight on Squats and Overhead Press if comfortable
Optionally add 1 rep (8 ‚Üí 9 reps)

exercises.name: Treadmill/Bike + Dynamic Stretches
exercises.notes: Arm circles, hip circles, bodyweight squats

exercises.name: Barbell Squats
exercises.notes: Add weight if form is solid

exercises.name: Dumbbell Bent-Over Rows
exercises.notes: Flat back, hinge at hips, row elbows back

exercises.name: Overhead Press
exercises.notes: Increase load or add 1 rep if easy

exercises.name: Plank
exercises.notes: Aim for 45s if 30s is easy

exercises.name: Biceps Curls
exercises.notes: Increase weight if comfortable

exercises.name: Triceps Overhead Extensions
exercises.notes: Elbows in, controlled lowering

tuesday.name: Cardio
notes: Intervals: Extend push intervals to 1:15‚Äì1:30 or reduce rest
Steady-State: 25‚Äì30 min at higher speed or slight incline

wednesday.name: Upper-Body Strength
notes: Increase Bench/Floor Press or Shoulder Press weight if form is good
Hold planks for 45‚Äì60s

exercises.name: Light Cardio + Upper Body Mobility
exercises.notes: Arm swings, shoulder rolls, scapular retractions

exercises.name: Bench Press or Floor Press
exercises.notes: Add weight if previous loads were easy

exercises.name: Bent-Over Row
exercises.notes: Flat back, pull elbows up and back

exercises.name: Shoulder Press
exercises.notes: Go heavier if comfortable

exercises.name: Side Planks (or Plank Variation)
exercises.notes: Progress from 45s to 60s

exercises.name: Biceps Curls
exercises.notes: Go heavier if all sets are easy

exercises.name: Triceps Extensions
exercises.notes: Elbows in, full extension

thursday.name: Cardio
notes: Same approach as Tuesday: intervals or steady-state at higher intensity
Consider ~30 min intervals or 35 min steady-state

friday.name: Lower-Body Strength
notes: Increase Deadlift or Lunge weight if form allows
Consider 4 total sets on main lifts
Add bar/dumbbell on Glute Bridges if bodyweight is easy

exercises.name: 5 min Easy Cardio + Dynamic Leg Swings
exercises.notes: Hip openers, bodyweight squats

exercises.name: Deadlifts
exercises.notes: Increase weight or add 4th set

exercises.name: Lunges
exercises.notes: Heavier dumbbells or add 4th set

exercises.name: Glute Bridges / Hip Thrusts
exercises.notes: Add a bar/dumbbell if bodyweight is too easy

exercises.name: Calf Raises
exercises.notes: Increase resistance if needed

exercises.name: Plank (~45s) & Bicycle Crunch (10 reps/side)
exercises.notes: Perform simultaneously, rest briefly, then repeat

saturday.name: Rest or Active Recovery
notes: Light walk/bike, foam roll, stretch

sunday.name: Full Rest
notes: No planned exercise

printingNotes: Print this 'Week 3' on a single sheet (front and back if desired)
Bring to your workout area or keep on your phone for reference
Check off sets/reps as you complete them and note any weight changes

4.title: Week 4

main: Push to current limits while staying safe
After this week, reassess progress and update goals

monday.name: Full-Body Strength
notes: Consider 4 sets on all main exercises if you have the time/energy
Increase reps to 10 if focusing on muscle size

exercises.name: Treadmill/Bike + Dynamic Stretches
exercises.notes: Arm circles, hip circles, bodyweight squats

exercises.name: Barbell Squats
exercises.notes: Increase to 4 sets or 10 reps if you want more volume

exercises.name: Dumbbell Bent-Over Rows
exercises.notes: Try heavier dumbbells or extra reps

exercises.name: Overhead Press
exercises.notes: Go to 4 sets or 10 reps if comfortable

exercises.name: Plank
exercises.notes: Aim for 60s if 30‚Äì45s is easy

exercises.name: Biceps Curls
exercises.notes: Challenge yourself with heavier weight or more reps

exercises.name: Triceps Overhead Extensions
exercises.notes: Control the descent, consider adding a set

tuesday.name: Cardio
notes: Intervals: 12‚Äì15 rounds or lengthen push intervals to 1:30
Steady-State: 30 min at moderate-hard effort or add incline

structure.name: Main Work
structure.notes: Increase speed or incline for extra challenge

wednesday.name: Upper-Body Strength
notes: 4 sets for Bench/Floor Press and Shoulder Press if possible
Increase row weight or reps
Planks to 60s or advanced variations (e.g., single-leg plank)

exercises.name: Light Cardio + Upper Body Mobility
exercises.notes: Arm swings, shoulder rolls, scapular retractions

exercises.name: Bench Press or Floor Press
exercises.notes: Consider 4 sets or 10 reps if you're aiming for hypertrophy

exercises.name: Bent-Over Row
exercises.notes: Increase weight if form is good

exercises.name: Shoulder Press
exercises.notes: Go for 4 sets or 10 reps if comfortable

exercises.name: Side Planks (or Plank Variation)
exercises.notes: Extend hold time or add difficulty

exercises.name: Biceps Curls
exercises.notes: Challenge with heavier weight or more reps

exercises.name: Triceps Extensions
exercises.notes: Elbows in, full extension

thursday.name: Cardio
notes: Add a few more intervals or run/bike longer
Push speed or resistance

friday.name: Lower-Body Strength
notes: 4 sets on Deadlifts/Lunges if desired
Heavier loads if form is solid
Bar/dumbbell on Glute Bridges if easy

exercises.name: 5 min Easy Cardio + Leg/Glute Activation
exercises.notes: Hip openers, leg swings, bodyweight squats

exercises.name: Deadlifts
exercises.notes: Go for 4 sets or 10 reps if strong enough

exercises.name: Lunges
exercises.notes: Increase dumbbell weight or add a set

exercises.name: Glute Bridges / Hip Thrusts
exercises.notes: Use a bar/dumbbell if bodyweight is too easy

exercises.name: Calf Raises
exercises.notes: Add heavier load if possible

exercises.name: Plank (~60s) & Bicycle Crunch (10-12 reps/side)
exercises.notes: Perform simultaneously, rest briefly, then repeat

saturday.name: Rest or Active Recovery
notes: Gentle walking, stretching, or yoga

sunday.name: Full Rest
notes: No planned exercise; recharge

printingNotes: Print this 'Week 4' on a single sheet (front and back if desired)
Bring to your workout area or keep on your phone for reference
Check off sets/reps as you complete them and note any weight changes
